numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that many countries have a high percentage of young people.
2. I noticed that in these countries many people say that the world gets better in each generation.
3. I noticed that Indonesia has a high percentage of people who think that the world gets better in each generation.
4. I noticed that Indonesia has a high percentage of people who think that the world gets worse in each generation.
5. Young people are more optimistic about future generations than old people.
6. I think that some old people think that young people are annoying.
7. I think that some old people think that young people are unpatriotic.
8. I think that some young people read history books.
9. I think that some young people see that wars happened before their generation.
10. I think that some young people see that bad things happened before their generation.
11. I wonder why some countries are not very optimistic.
12. I wonder why some countries are very optimistic.
13. I wonder whether the number of old people in a country affects optimism in the country.
14. I wonder whether the economic stability of a country affects optimism in the country.
15. I wonder whether something else affects optimism in a country.
16. Being optimistic about future generations is important for my community.
17. The United States is a country.
18. In the United States many young people are optimistic about future generations.
19. The title is: Excited for the future, maybe not.
